title: When using Skill tool, show skill name
close_reason: Implemented in Sprint 3 (tool-display-enrich), commit 94dd3a3. _tool_detail() extracts skill name from Skill tool input.

title: When using Bash tool, show bash command name and a few args
close_reason: Implemented in Sprint 3 (tool-display-enrich), commit 94dd3a3. _tool_detail() extracts first line of bash command.

title: Streaming text not aggregated into final block - shows chunked output with newlines
description:
When a streaming text block finishes, the final rendered output still shows the raw chunked streaming fragments separated by newlines instead of the complete aggregated text. Each SSE chunk appears on its own line, producing output like:

All

7 tracked
 be
ads
 are closed

Expected: once streaming completes, the block should re-render with the full concatenated text as a single paragraph.
close_reason: Fixed in commit 1545b4e. StreamingRichLog.finalize() now consolidates consecutive TextDeltaBlock objects into a single TextContentBlock before returning to ConversationView.

title: Virtually render the conversation panel
close_reason: Implemented in Sprint 1 (widget-arch). ConversationView uses ScrollView + Line API with virtual rendering via render_line().

title: Headers functionality should show HTTP headers
close_reason: Implemented in Sprint 5 (http-headers), commit aa5ae61. Proxy emits HTTP headers, displayed under headers filter toggle.

title: Show something meaningful for tool results when collapsed
close_reason: Implemented in Sprint 4 (tool-correlation-summaries), commit 721e7a7. Tool results show summary with tool name when collapsed.

title: Show front-ellipsed filename for Read tool
close_reason: Implemented in Sprint 3 (tool-display-enrich), commit 94dd3a3. _tool_detail() extracts file_path and front-ellipses it via _front_ellipse_path().

title: Tool use and tool_response should be correlated via colors
close_reason: Implemented in Sprint 4 (tool-correlation-summaries), commit 721e7a7. Tool use/result pairs share correlated colors via tool_use_id lookup.
